ratings.comment: I began this class leery because she tends to assume everyone is in it for the ethnic studies credit and that no body cares about the material.  This being said, she loves when you ask thoughtful questions about native american culture and show interest.  The readings aren't necessary every class period, but I usually find them really interesting.

She is very opinionated to the point of bashing other tribes/reservations. It really bothered me that she was so critical of/ didn't seem to know much a about feminism for a class that is cross listed as Gender & Women's Studies, additionally it seems like at times she assumed we as students were anti-American Indian, which left me very frustrated.

I've never had such a disorganized, contradictory, and opinionated teacher. She bases many things on her own tribe (the blackfeet) but seems knowledgable enough in most concepts of American Indian Women. Brushes off questions to keep rambling on. Very often says "oh I forgot to bring ___ this time, I'll bring it later". 2 papers, 1 midterm

She is a bad professor but knows the information she goes ON AND ON about. Rude and disorganized. 3 tests with no clear grading criteria. Final was a paper that she just made up for the first time this year and had LITERALLY NO grading criteria. Expect some work for an A but it is obtainable. My recommendation is just don't bother taking the class.

Theresa was my favorite professor. She only had short readings for each class and all that was required was a single notecard describing what you read. She loves participation and that is the way to earn her respect. I'm not majoring in anything related to the class, so my feedback is not biased. Very easy class.

She's probably the worst teacher I've had at UW-Madison. Doesn't understand technology and babbles on about stuff that could be made up for all we know. She contradicts herself constantly and is a harsh grader of work that shouldn't be graded harshly.

while she IS a little disorganized, she loves the topics that she is teaching and always asks what WE want to know about the subject. Very flexible but wants to know that we have done our part (short readings). Overall easy and interesting

Refused to post grades; Assigned lots of busy work that was usually graded harshly; Didn't like to help students outside of class. However, the grading scale did make it reasonable to earn a good grade with effort.

She is honestly one of the most disorganized, least caring, and most useless teacher I've had in college. The class itself is a potential easy A (LOTS OF WORK) and lectures are painfully boring. This is from one of her emails "Do not e-mail me about this message because I will not asnwer." And I'm pretty sure she hates everyone in the class.

Not too hard, but the class is painfully boring to sit through, and attendance is required. She babbles on for the whole power lecture in a disorganized manner that is impossible to follow. She is the most confused lecturer I have ever had, and she brushes off interesting questions in order to continue throwing out random, unconnected facts

Professor Schenk is a great woman who cares passionately about this subject. The class is very easy yet still very informative. Although a bit set in her ways about certain things, if you comply to her policies you will have no problem doing well and thoroughly enjoying this class.

She is a nice woman and truly cares about the success of students.  As long as you keep up with assignments, the rest of class is a breeze.  Attendance is a must.  Unfortunately, a lot of her teaching is opinion.  But you do learn plenty.

Professor Schenck is the worst professor I have had in 4 years at UW-Madison.  She may be qualified to teach in her field, but she has no business teaching American Indian Studies/Sociology 639.  She says outrageous things that are factually incorrect, including  "Wisconsin reservations are luxurious" on 11-13-2006.  This is obviously incorrect.
